sentences.en: A trickle of flowing mud may precede a larger flow.
sentences.cn: 很小的一股泥石流可能会先于更大的流量.

sentences.en: a type of cloud that precedes rain
Agricultural development simply must precede economic development.
sentences.cn: 农业的发展必须在整个经济发展中处于领先地位.

sentences.en: All positional ( unnamed ) parameters must precede any named parameters.
sentences.cn: 所有的位置 ( 未命名 ) 参数必须位于任何命名的参数之前.

sentences.en: As mentioned before , vibrations almost always precede a seperation of bodies.
sentences.cn: 如前所述, 振动几乎总是出现在身体分离之前.
定语形容词位于名词前.

sentences.en: Cell damage by disruption of the cell wall and plasmamembrane must precede virus entry.
sentences.cn: 病毒进入植物之前,细胞肯定由于细胞壁和(或)原生质膜的破坏已经受到伤害.

sentences.en: Consonants are frequently assimilated to the consonants which they precede.
sentences.cn: 子音常被其后所接之子音所同化((如ads(成为ass)等)).

sentences.en: He dissatisfied that I am promoted precede him.
sentences.cn: 他不满我先于他被提升.

sentences.en: It is a rule of English that adjectives generally precede the noun they modify: we say "a good cry", not "a cry good".
sentences.cn: 英语规定形容词通常放在其修饰的名词前：我们说agoodcry，不说acrygood。

sentences.en: It is a rule of English that adjectives generally precede the noun they modify.
sentences.cn: 形容词一般放在所修饰名词的前面是英语中的一条规律。

sentences.en: Line | 1 : All controls must precede menus; cannot load control | 2.
sentences.cn: 行| 1: 所有的控件都必须优先于菜单; 无法加载控件|2.

sentences.en: Lunch will be preceded by a short speech from the chairman.
sentences.cn: 午餐开始之前主席会发表一段简短的讲话。

sentences.en: Restlessness, anxiety , confusion, and twitching may also precede convulsions.
sentences.cn: 惊厥前也可出现躁动,烦燥, 错觉, 抽搐等症状.

sentences.en: The guard preceded them down the corridor.
sentences.cn: 警卫带领他们穿过了走廊。

sentences.en: The new algorithm precede to ago algorithm by simulation.
sentences.cn: 通过计算机仿真,证实了这种新的算法优于以往的算法.

sentences.en: This puts the cart before the horse; elections should follow, not precede, agreement on a constitution.
sentences.cn: 这样做是本末倒置；选举应该在宪法确定之后举行，而不是之前。

sentences.en: Whatever the outcome, we must resolutely precede with our objective.
sentences.cn: 无论结果如何, 我们必须坚定地继续为目标而努力.

trans.tran_en: to happen or exist before something or someone, or to come before something else in a series
to happen or exist before something or someone, or to come before something else in a series

trans.tran_cn: 在…之前发生或出现，先于，在…之上，优于，给…作序，处于…前面的位置
